in a way that relates to mineralogy (= the scientific study of minerals): Although mineralogically the sediments are dissimilar, they may share a common origin. The gold is mineralogically complex during processing.
More examplesFewer examplesThe new area is similar geologically to the old one, but it differs mineralogically.Mineralogically, the mine is best known for producing good-quality specimens of bright apple-green fluorite during the 1930s.This is one of the ten most mineralogically diverse deposits in the world.
